content: Courses: Software Engineering, Distributed Systems, Operating Systems, Advanced Algorithms, Experience Design

description: Utilized data visualization tools such as Three.js to improve customer understanding of complex 3D design models by 20%.
Achieved customer satisfaction of 80% architecting CMS using D3.js.
Reduced server costs by 50% by utilizing advanced knowledge of microservices architecture on AWS and combined suitable balance of Lambda and EC2.
Improved scalability and developer experience by converting the base from PHP, Yii to React + Typescript.
Implemented Jest, and Cypress in TDD, achieving a test coverage of 90%.
Led the team of 5 engineers and conducted 2+ reviews daily to ensure reliable and high quality coding practices resulting in a 30% reduction in bugs and overall improvement in cOde quality.

Implemented a notification system using AWS Lambda, SNS, and SES for automated delivery alerts and product recommendations, resulting in a 19% increase in customer satisfaction and a 15% boost in repeat purchases.
Increased user engagement by 125% by establishing a new advertising and leaderboard page with Next.js, resulting in a highly positive user experience.
Built a Stripe payment processing and inventory management microservice utilizing Node.js and AWS Lambda, reducing payment processing time by 30% and increasing successful transactions by 20%.
Mentored junior engineers in an effective manner, cultivating their understanding of software engineering principles.
Built pixel‑perfect, mobile‑first, and interactive components resulting in a 35% increase in user satisfaction.
Implemented complex frontend features such as optimizing performance resulting in a 30% improvement in website loading time and a 15% increase in accessibility compliance score.
Demonstrated strong problem‑solving skills and the ability to quickly identify and resolve technical issues in a team setting, resulting in a 20% reduction in post‑release bugs.
Communicated technical concepts and project status updates clearly and effectively to non‑technical stakeholders, resulting in a 15% increase in stakeholder satisfaction.

blog.title: User Experience Design – A little more than just design
